New Records: Greece recorded their first victory over England.
Key Match Events: Evangelos Pavlidis scored the opening goal for Greece in the 49th minute.
Jude Bellingham equalized for England with a side-footed curler.
Evangelos Pavlidis scored the last-gasp winner for Greece in stoppage time.
Three Greece goals were disallowed for offside.
Jordan Pickford made a crucial error leading to a near goal for Greece, saved by Levi Colwill.
Ollie Watkins and Dominic Solanke were brought on as substitutes to change England's formation.
Pre-Game Insights: Lee Carsley opted for an attacking lineup with Jude Bellingham, Phil Foden, and Cole Palmer in central areas, and Bukayo Saka and Anthony Gordon on the wings.
Carsley emphasized an aggressive approach, focusing on asking questions of the opposition.
Post-Match Reflections: The Greece players dedicated their victory to George Baldock, the England-born Greece international who drowned in a swimming pool.
There were concerns that Lee Carsley's bold approach may have impacted his chances for the permanent managerial position.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was marked by fluidity in England's lineup, with Trent Alexander-Arnold stepping up into midfield from right-back.
England struggled with cohesion and were vulnerable to Greece's counter-attacks.
